observation: I see a sign-up page asking me to select my residence. There's a country/region dropdown field that currently shows 'Select' as a placeholder. I can see there are many language options appearing to be overlaying or blocking some content. Below is a 'Next' button and at the bottom there are links for 'Log in' and a 'Sign up now' button. The main country selector appears to be element 45 with the input field showing 'Select'.
reasoning: As an elderly user, I need to select my country of residence to proceed with the sign-up. I should first tap on the country dropdown to see available options. The dropdown currently shows 'Select' as placeholder text.
ux_issues: Language selector overlay may be confusing - it's taking up significant screen space
Multiple overlapping elements make the interface cluttered for elderly users
The country selector field could be larger for easier interaction

outcome.visual_observation: Tapping on the Country/region dropdown field successfully opened a modal/overlay showing a searchable list of countries. The interface changed from showing a simple dropdown with 'Select' placeholder text to displaying a comprehensive country selection interface with a search bar at the top and an alphabetical list of countries including Guinea-Bissau, Guyana, Haiti, Honduras, Hungary, Iceland, India, Indonesia, Iraq, Ireland, Israel, Italy, Jamaica, Japan, and Kazakhstan visible.
